page.title: 17BURTON PIDSEA VILLAGE HALL
page.content: Plans for a prefabricated hall were put before the people of Burton Pidsea in April, 1953 and construction began in November of the same year. The Memorial Hall was opened on March 31st, 1954. In 1950, Mr. T. Harrison had donated a piece of land, next to the hall's proposed site, for use as a playing field. The Hall is very well used for a variety of purposes. It provides the premises for the Child Health Clinic and Blood Donor Clinic. Sports' Groups, Children's Groups and Clubs, Church Groups and Farming and Horticultural Societies are all regular users of the Hall. It is also open for social events. One of the major events of the year is the Carnival which takes place for the sole purpose of raising funds for the Memorial Hall and Playing Field.
